problem: A drawer contains 3 white balls and 6 black balls.  Two balls are drawn out of the box at random.  What is the probability that they both are white?
solution: There are $\binom{9}{2} = 36$ combinations of two balls that can be drawn.  There are $\binom{3}{2} = 3$ combinations of two white balls that can be drawn.  So the probability that two balls pulled out are both white is $\dfrac{3}{36} = \boxed{\dfrac{1}{12}}$.
